author: bshock84
post_text: April 17, 2016 at 3:13 AM#1Anyone know if there's a way to disable a range of macros from the commandline?  Wanting to create a macro that disables all of my song macros, so an opening act LD can't accidentally fire one of my song macros.-- Ben.

posts.author: bshock84
posts.post_text: April 17, 2016 at 3:13 AM#1Anyone know if there's a way to disable a range of macros from the commandline?  Wanting to create a macro that disables all of my song macros, so an opening act LD can't accidentally fire one of my song macros.-- Ben.

posts.author: Duplicate bentoylight
posts.post_text: April 17, 2016 at 10:36 AM#2assign macro x thru y /disabled=yes (or no) --for a range of macrosassign macro thru /disabled=yes --for all macrosassign macro 1.x.y thru z /disabled=yes -- for a range of lines in one macro (x=macro, y and z = lines)if your songs macros are labeled "song 1", "song 2" etc.. :assign macro "song *" /disabled=yesEnjoy

title: Disabling a range of macros commandline
